posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

Now it's time for the dwarven henchwoman of the SoU campaign, Dorna Trapspringer. The ambitious little dwarven Rogue dwarf-style. I know that for powerbuilding, I could just make her a Dex-based Epic Dodging, Sneak Attacking Cleric Monk Rogue, but that wouldn't fit her personality, and as tempting as it seemed, my goal was to make builds that made sense for these henchmen, that would be in their own merit optimized but also that would make sense in their stories. Dorna loved some treasure-hunting, and although she was also a Cleric, her main calling was a Rogue. But she was always more of a brutish type than a dextrous one, so I made her a Strength-based Cleric Fighter Rogue, giving her EWS in her famed Battleaxe so she could be good at inflicting pain. In addition to that, she has 12d6 of Sneak damage and Crippling Strike. She can use Word of Faith to blind her opponents and then sneak them to death in a heartbeat, or skydive their strength. Too bad she only gets Concentration at 40... That is one thing I wish I could avoid...

Here is the result: Dorna Trapspringer, ladies and gentlemen!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Some minor exposition for those following the build...
  • -20% XP Penalty for 33 levels total.
  • Search skill inadequate to spot epic traps (minimum Search 23, modified needed).  Trickery domain declined so the level must be intrinsic to the build.
  • UMD 35 (33) needed to assure casting perfection of all scrolls (Level 9 and lower).  Current level (30) avoids failure for casting level 6 scrolls and lower.
